3 Analytically reproducible documents (1)
These documents typically contain 3 main types of content, integrating code and natural language in a way that is called ‚Äúliterate programming‚Äù.


Formatted text
Code commands
Code outputs



These are languages that can be written using any plain text editor. They use markup elements to define how text should be displayed or printed.



3.0.1 HTML
HTML is used to structure content on the web.


<b>This text will be displayed in bold</b>





3.0.2 LaTeX
LaTeX is used for academic and technical documents.

library(reticulate)

Replace ‚ÄúC:/ProgramData/anaconda3/python.exe‚Äù with the path to your desired Python executable.

Sys.setenv(RETICULATE_PYTHON = "C:/ProgramData/anaconda3/python.exe")

2 Setup
To integrate Python within a Quarto notebook that primarily uses R code chunks (i.e., executed with the knitr engine), you will need the reticulate R package, which serves as a bridge between R and Python, allowing you to run Python code chunks alongside R and share objects between the two languages.

Install reticulate if it is not already installed.


```{r}
install.packages("reticulate")
```


To ensure that R uses the correct Python executable, specify the path to Python using the Sys.setenv() function. This is especially important if you have multiple Python installations on your system or are using a specific environment, such as Anaconda. Replace ‚ÄúC:/ProgramData/anaconda3/python.exe‚Äù with the path to your desired Python executable. You can also add this permanently in your R environment variables using .Renviron. Consistently use the same Python environment in reticulate, as this prevents version conflicts and package incompatibilities.


```{r}
Sys.setenv(RETICULATE_PYTHON = "C:/ProgramData/anaconda3/python.exe")
```


Load reticulate at the beginning of your Quarto notebook and confirm the version being used with py_config().


```{r}
library(reticulate)
reticulate::py_config()
```

section: 5 Best practices for inter-language data sharing
text:
5 Best practices for inter-language data sharing

Data Structure Compatibility: Ensure that data structures are compatible. For example, R data frames are automatically converted to pandas data frames in Python, but other complex R objects may not be directly accessible in Python.
Chunk Execution Order: Run code chunks in the correct order to avoid errors due to missing objects or incomplete definitions. Use clear and consistent chunk labels for cross-referencing.
Performance Considerations: Keep in mind that transferring large data frames between R and Python may introduce some overhead. Where possible, limit the size of data passed across languages.

This setup provides a powerful approach for combining R‚Äôs statistical capabilities with Python‚Äôs data manipulation and machine learning tools, enabling a robust, mixed-language workflow within Quarto.

5 Best practices

Ensure that data structures are compatible. For example, R data frames are automatically converted to pandas data frames in Python, but other complex R objects may not be directly accessible in Python.
Keep in mind that transferring large data frames between R and Python may introduce some overhead. Where possible, limit the size of data passed across languages.
